text:
24/10/2016 @home - 33cl bottle from a trade with tderoeck.
Clear orange medium head leaving a small lacing. Nose is incredibly fruity (peach, grapefruit, mango, ...), a bit sweetness. Taste is all fruity again, sweet touch, bitter hops ending. Nice. At least one of their low alcohol IPAs should be brewed at a regular base. Please?

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2016 Mooi licht oranje van kleur met romige witte schuimkraag. Lekker fruitig in de neus. Mooi fruitig-bitter en lekker vol en romig in de mond. Perfecte balans met lange hoppige afdronk. Tropisch fruit, pomelo, lychee, perzik, beetje meloen. Totem did it again. Een bier van nog geen 3% abv zo barstensvol met smaak !! Na de Chac is dit alwéér een topper !!!
Hazy orange liquid, average head. Strong, fruity aroma of hops. Light body, strong carbonation. Taste is bitter and a bit weak.

Très belle robe blonde, fine mousse. Un nez qui explose de notes dagrumes, de fruits exotiques, de mangue, sur un fond de houblon frais, de lélégance et de la complexité. Bouche délicieusement fraîche, amère et fruitée, dune élégance impressionnante avec une finale ultra raffraîchissante. Une bière de soif et de plaisir, à boire sans modération.

Bottle 0.33l at Ratebeer Belgian Summer Gathering 2016 Evergem, Belgium. 03.09.2016. Thanks Klaas for hosting and RB guys for sharing todays beers. Pour it hazy golden color with small white head. Aroma pine, leaves, yeasty note. Taste crispy, smooth creamy texture, grapefruit zest on the back, so full body and drinkable, wait 2.9% abv, perfect balanced, creamy, lively, long finish.
33 cl bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is grapefruity and peachy. Smooth fruity, crisp hoppy. Dry. Peachy and crisp fruity finish.

Sampled from 0.33 l bottle at RBBSG 2016 in Evergem. Hazy, orangeish yellow with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, white head. Fruity-grassy aroma of lemon, mango and pineapple. Quite bitter, grassy-fruity taste of lemon, mango, orange and pineapple, followed by a medium long, quite bitter, very dry finish. Thin to medium body, quite effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Good!

F: average, off-white, average retention.
C: gold, hazy, opaque.
A: citrus, tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, juicy.
T: malt, tangerine, grapefruits, hint of barnyard, herbal, good fresh hoppy bitterness, medium light body, good carbonation, wou absolutely lovely beer for this 2,9%, very refreshing and worth to try, I must to have the others from this brewery, 33cl bottle shared at RBBSG V (2016), many thanks.

Sampled @ Ratebeer Belgian Summer Gathering 2016. Clear golden color, small off-white head. Aroma is super hoppy, tropical fruit hops and crisp. Tastes the same: super hoppy, tropical fruit and nice suitable bitterness. Absolutely lovely!

Thnx to the Brewers ! Pours clear blonde. Ok White head. Smell is full, hoppy. Bit aromatic ,mild bitterness. Taste is intense, fresh, crispy. Ok bitterness, aromatic (tropical fruits ) very Nice Indeed.
33cl bottle. Pours hazy deep golden colour with a huge good lasting off-white head. Aroma of fresh bitter hops and grainy malt. Taste of bitter grassy hops, earthy, grainy malt, long bitter finish.

Taste from tap on 20.08.16 GBF.
Hazy darkgolden to orange color, with a white head.
Aroma: tropical fruits, hops, touch from caramel. Medium body.
Taste: very low sweet start, refreshing and good exotic fruits, nice bitterness.
LOVELY BEER !
Great beer for such a low alc.

Draft, thanks Klaas.
Dorée présentant un léger voile orange, col épais jaunâtre persistant.
Arôme au nez fruité puissant tirant sur de belles effluves tropicales alternant entre mangue et un côté agrumes de pamplemousse, rétro fin malté + une certaine base levure apportant le caractère plus vivant.
Palais est juicy, tropical oscillant vers mangue avec un caractère grains assez marqué, du haut de ses 2.9% elle reste superbement légère et complexe. Pointe dépice et note herbacée.

Draught at GBF, cheers Klaas! Thick, egg-white, dense, lacing head over a cloudy peach blonde beer. Delicate New World hops aroma of lime blossom, grapefruit flesh, moldy orange peel, mango, unripe pineapple, green banana, white bread and bakers yeast notes underneath. Vivid fruitiness in the mouth, raw pineapple, green banana and some apricot notes, bit fizzy, lightly oily mouthfeel, supple middle with a caramelly touch leading to a fragrantly aromatic hop finish, notably citrusy with hints of grapefruit and tangerine, spicy touch but not harshly bittering, very refreshing. Delicate thirst quencher, packed with flavor and not even feeling too thin for such a low ABV beer - I wish there were hundreds of different session IPAs like this in Belgium, for functional reasons (driving!) alone.
Pours an orange colour. Taste is hoppy and fruity with tropical fruits. Tasted at Gents Bier Festival 2016
Hazy blond with thin head. Very full flavoured. Really fresh and hoppy. Very easy to drink.

Goudblond/oranjekleurig met wit schuim. Geur: mandarijn, hoppig, C-hop, pompelmoes, maar ook exotisch. Smaak: fris hoppig, bitter, pompelmoes en zeer licht zoetig. Redelijk volmondig voor zo weinig alcohol. Lekker bier, top in zijn genre!

Thank you for sharing! Sampled draft @ Gents Bierfestival 2016. Very hazy orange, little white head. Nose is massive hop, bit dank, rich overripe fruit, peach, apricot, low grapefruit. Taste is dank, hay, thick overripe fruit hop, low dough, grapefruit, overripe peach, Yeast is low. Hop is huge, making the body a bit hard to drink for me ironically, Hop is huge overripe stone fruit. Quite nice, I didnt go wild like the others did but I quite appreciated it all the same.

Draught  Small rest of head remaining; fully hazy orange-ochre beer. Rosewater, rosepetals, sweet pink grapefruit. Light citrussy-hoppy flavour with a finish as from grapefruitpeel. Light but not watery, bit sticky yet refreshing. Great!
Tap at Gents Bierfestival. Trillium in session version. Probably the best session IPA Belgium has ever made, to my knowledge. Absolutely stellar.

12/VIII/16 - 33cl bottle from the brewer @ home - BB: n/a (2016-835) Thanks to Klaas for my "prima nocta" bottle!
Very hazy orange beer, irregular off-white head, pretty stable, little adhesive. Aroma: tropical fruit, caramel malts, slight hint of sulphur, grapefruit, tropical fruits, what an aroma bomb! MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: oh yes, thats the sweet spot baby! Tropical fruit overload, pineapple, passion fruit, grapefruit, soft sweetness from the caramel malts, citrus, lovely bitterness. Aftertaste: grapefruit, citrus, nice bitter hops, just lovely stuff, considering this is only 2.9% (well, and less even)
Bottle from Geers. Hazy amber colour, white foam. Nose of tropical fruits (pineapple, lychee), very bitter and dry hoppy finish. Very nice session IPA!
